titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Elias Fries papers, 1869-1884
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: The collection consists of letters from Fries to his mother, Lisetta Maria (Vogler) Fries, largely dating from while he was a student at Davidson College between 1874 and 1877. Topics include his studies, his professors, his friends, and general activities of student life. The collection also contains a volume: Catalogue of the Products of the Woolen Mills, Cotton Mills, Flouring Mills of F.&H. Fries, Salem, N.C. (New York: 1880s?), which has cloth samples attached.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Henry Elias Fries Papers, 1869-1884, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Fries attended Davidson College and later was a state representative and manufacturer from Forsyth County, N.C. He was the first president of the South Side Manufacturing Company and the Forsyth Manufacturing Company; the Fries Manufacturing and Power Co. was the first electrical transmission plant in N.C., transmitting electricity to factories in Winston-Salem.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of letters from Fries to his mother, Lisetta Maria (Vogler) Fries, largely dating from while he was a student at Davidson College between 1874 and 1877. Topics include his studies, his professors, his friends, and general activities of student life. The collection also contains a volume: Catalogue of the Products of the Woolen Mills, Cotton Mills, Flouring Mills of F.&H. Fries, Salem, N.C. (New York: 1880s?), which has cloth samples attached.
